thread.title: Raiders lose to Bears on late field goal
thread.title_full: Raiders lose to Bears on late field goal

author:
Jimmy Durkin

jdurkin@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Raiders lose to Bears on late field goal
text:
Raiders lose to Bears on late field goal By Jimmy Durkin Posted: 10/04/2015 01:20:37 PM PDT Updated: 10/04/2015 03:06:33 PM PDT CHICAGO -- A supposedly hobbled quarterback wasn't enough of an advantage for the Raiders. 
The Chicago Bears' Jay Cutler played through a hamstring injury that sidelined him a week ago and was healthy enough to guide his team to a 22-20 win over the Raiders on Sunday at Solidier Field. 
Robbie Gould booted a 49-yard field goal on the next to last play of the game to send the Raiders to a crushing defeat and snap their two-game winning streak. 
Oakland took a 20-19 lead with 2:05 to play on a 41-yard field goal by Sebastian Janikowski. 
Until the Bears drove in the final two minutes, it looked like Charles Woodson might be the hero again. Marquess Wilson (10) of the Chicago Bears is tackled by David Amerson (29) of the Oakland Raiders in the second quarter at Soldier Field on Oct. 4, 2015, in Chicago. (Jonathan Daniel/Getty Images) 
Woodson intercepted Cutler with 6:50 left to play. On a deep pass to tight end Martellus Bennett, Woodson undercut the route and picked it off to give the Raiders a chance. 
A penalty on the Raiders sideline forced Oakland to start at their its 9 and two big pass plays from Derek Carr to Michael Crabtree helped them push down the field. 
Roy Helu, who replaced Latavius Murray at running back after he fumbled a pitch and had a pass bounce off him for an interception, was stuffed on a third-and-2 play from the Bears' 22 to force the field goal attempt. 
Janikowski, who tied Tim Brown's Raiders record for all-time games played at 240, kicked a 41-yarder that gave Oakland the lead with 2:05 to go. Advertisement 
But the Bears converted an early fourth-down on that final possession and moved down into field goal position to earn their first win of the season. 
For more on the Raiders, visit the Inside the Oakland Raiders blog at ibabuzz.com/oaklandraiders . Follow Jimmy Durkin on Twitter at Twitter.com/Jimmy_Durkin .
